Participants.evidence: We reviewed 330 patients who received perioperative TPE between September 2012 and September 2017.

Intervention.evidence: 24 patients received TPE for HIT before anticipated heparin use for CPB.

Objective.evidence: We hypothesized that TPE with heparin re-exposure will not lead to HIT-related thromboembolic events, bleeding, or increased mortality after cardiac surgery with CPB.

Method_Outcome.evidence: Thromboembolic events (TE) occurred in 3 patients within 7 days of surgery; of those, two were possibly HIT-related.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 24 patients received TPE for HIT before anticipated heparin use for CPB.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Three patients (12.5%) died within 30 days after surgery but none of the deaths were considered HIT-related.

Harms.evidence: Thromboembolic events (TE) occurred in 3 patients within 7 days of surgery; of those, two were possibly HIT-related.
